globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
As you arrive at Haven, you are nearly paralyzed with shock at the scene. 

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.

eventActions.theText: Buildings are ablaze everywhere as Imperials march through the settlement, killing or arresting fleeing survivors.

You shake off your horror, knowing that the people of Haven need your help. You press forward past the burning village toward the battle to help as many survivors as possible escape the carnage.

{-} Neutral mission tokens represent evacuees. Evacuees on a tile whose door is closed are trapped. When that door opens, those evacuees are liberated.
{-} At the end of each round, the Empire claims 1 trapped evacuee.

In the distance, you see Imperial landing ships approaching. You draw your weapons and rush into the village.

{-} Imperial reinforcements will arrive at the end of Round 5.
{-} The mission will progress when a door is opened.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 7 evacuees.
Open a door. Evacuees detained: &Refugees Empire&/7

{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent evacuees. Evacuees on a tile whose door is closed are trapped. When that door opens, those evacuees are liberated.
{-} At the end of each round, the Empire claims 1 trapped evacuee.
{-} Imperial reinforcements will arrive at the end of Round 5.
{-} The mission will progress when a door is opened.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 7 evacuees.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
More Imperials keep arriving from outlying regions of Haven, and you realize that you've saved everyone you can. Fighting a bitter rear guard action, you escort the civilians back to
your ship. As soon as the last civilian is aboard, you seal the hatch and wave your pilot off: You still need to find Benex.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
After the battle you search desperately for Benex, finding him in the wreckage of his old home. He holds a broken communicator in his hand.

“They came anyway...” he says. “I gave them everything they asked for in exchange for safety, and they killed my people anyway.”

On a nearby computer terminal you see records of communication with Sorin including Alliance security codes, records of Alliance secret projects, and, most frighteningly of all, access codes to, and the location of, the nearest major Rebel outpost. You rush to your ship; you are the last hope that base has.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Our Last Hope” into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
The onslaught is too massive. The few souls you've saved are Haven's only survivors as the Imperial troops force you to retreat.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
After the battle you search desperately for Benex, finding him in the wreckage of his old home. He holds a broken communicator in his hand.

“They came anyway...” he says. “I gave them everything they asked for in exchange for safety, and they killed my people anyway.”

On a nearby computer terminal you see records of communication with Sorin including Alliance security codes, records of Alliance secret projects, and, most frighteningly of all, access codes to, and the location of, the nearest major Rebel outpost. You rush to your ship; you are the last hope that base has.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Our Last Hope” into play.

globalEvents.name: Empire Claims Refugee WH1
globalEvents.eventText: You hear screams from somewhere in Haven. Another citizen in the warehouse is gunned down or dragged away by Imperial soldiers.

entityProperties.name: Refugee WH1
entityProperties.theText:
Some citizens have found shelter in Haven's warehouse.

{-} Evacuees on a tile whose door is closed are trapped. When that door opens, those evacuees are liberated.

globalEvents.name: Warehouse open
globalEvents.eventText:
The door to the warehouse finally slides open, and the evacuees rush out as you cover their retreat.

{-} The evacuees in the warehouse are now liberated. They can be rescued and moved by the Rebels and attacked by the Empire.

{-} The door is locked. A hero can interact with a door {(K} or {I}) to try and open it.

globalEvents.name: The General
globalEvents.eventText:
Booms and crashes rattle the air as buildings continue to fall in ruin under the onslaught of the Imperial force. Then, added to the noise are large thuds that begin to shake the ground as a massive machine of war lumbers toward your skirmish.

You hear the amplified voice of General Sorin emanating from this AT-ST, shouting orders to his troops with terrifying ferocity. With flame and destruction in his wake, he aims the large blasters of his vehicle in your direction.

eventActions.bonuses:
MORTAR: At the start of this activation, each hero may test {K}. If a hero is in an exterior space, it may test {J} instead. Each hero that does not pass becomes <color="red">Weakened</color>.
FOCUS: At the start of this activation, this figure becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.
GRENADE LAUNCHER: After this figure resolves an attack, roll 1 yellow die. Each Rebel within X spaces of the target suffers 1 {H} for each activation token. X is the Accuracy result.
eventActions.abilities: Awkward: Sorin's AT-ST cannot attack adjacent figures.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{-} BOMBARDMENT: This figure’s attacks do not require line of sight or Accuracy, and each gains Blast 1 {H}.
{Q} Attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 5 to reposition 2.
{Q} Attack {rebel}.
{A} Recover 2 {H}.
{-} ADVANCED FIREPOWER: Each adjacent Imperial figure becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

globalEvents.name: Target change
globalEvents.eventText:
Now that you can see better how much people there are still left, you realize you won't be able to save everyone. You hurry forward, dedicated to rescue as many as possible.

{-} Heroes gain {A}: Push an adjacent evacuee up to 4 spaces.
{-} At the start of each Round, the Rebels rescue a liberated evacuee. Then, they may move each additional liberated evacuee up to 4 spaces. Evacuees cannot end their movement in a space containing another evacuee.
{-} An Imperial figure can attack an evacuee (Health: 5, Defense: None). While an evacuee adjacent to a healthy hero is defending, it adds 1 white die to its defense pool. When an evacuee is defeated, the Empire claims that evacuee. Click the red highlight and select "Evacuee defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the Rebel players have rescued 6 evacuees.

entityProperties.name: Empire Highlight
entityProperties.theText: When an evacuee is defeated, click "Evacuee defeated".

eventActions.theText: Rescue the evacuees. Evacuees rescued: &Refugees Rebels&/6; evacuees detained: &Refugees Empire&/7

{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent evacuees. Evacuees on a tile whose door is closed are trapped. When that door opens, those evacuees are liberated.
{-} At the end of each round, the Empire claims 1 trapped evacuee.
{-} Heroes gain {A}: Push an adjacent evacuee up to 4 spaces.
{-} At the start of each Round, the Rebels rescue a liberated evacuee. Then, they may move each additional liberated evacuee up to 4 spaces. Evacuees cannot end their movement in a space containing another evacuee.
{-} An Imperial figure can attack an evacuee (Health: 5, Defense: None). While an evacuee adjacent to a healthy hero is defending, it adds 1 white die to its defense pool. When an evacuee is defeated, the Empire claims that evacuee. Click the red highlight and select "Evacuee defeated".
{-} Imperial reinforcements will arrive at the end of Round 5.
{-} The Rebels win when the Rebel players have rescued 6 evacuees.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 7 evacuees.

globalEvents.name: Evacuee rescued
globalEvents.eventText:
You rush another evacuee to safety as you urge the others on.

{-} Claim 1 liberated evacuee. Then, you may move each additional liberated evacuee up to 4 spaces. Evacuees cannot end their movement in a space containing another evacuee.

eventActions.theText: Is there at least 1 unclaimed, liberated evacuee?

You try to force open the door to the warehouse.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the door doesn't really budge. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

eventActions.theText:
You hastily try to open the gate to the backyard.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the gate doesn't really budge. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

eventActions.theText:
You try to force open the door to the recycling plant control room.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but the door doesn't really budge. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

globalEvents.name: Evacuee defeated
globalEvents.eventText: Another citizen of Haven falls under the Imperial onslaught.

globalEvents.name: Round 5 Over
globalEvents.eventText:
Imperial landing ships approach. Soon, the strength of the Emperor's forces will be overwhelming.

{-} The Empire receives additional threat at the end of each Round.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to try and open it.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent evacuees. Evacuees on a tile whose door is closed are trapped. When that door opens, those evacuees are liberated.
{-} At the end of each round, the Empire claims 1 trapped evacuee.
{-} Heroes gain {A}: Push an adjacent evacuee up to 4 spaces.
{-} At the start of each Round, the Rebels rescue a liberated evacuee. Then, they may move each additional liberated evacuee up to 4 spaces. Evacuees cannot end their movement in a space containing another evacuee.
{-} An Imperial figure can attack an evacuee (Health: 5, Defense: None). While an evacuee adjacent to a healthy hero is defending, it adds 1 white die to its defense pool. When an evacuee is defeated, the Empire claims that evacuee. Click the red highlight and select "Evacuee defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the Rebel players have rescued 6 evacuees.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 7 evacuees.

globalEvents.name: End Mission Sorin Yes
globalEvents.eventText: Because Sorin's AT-ST was defeated, the heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End Mission Sorin No
globalEvents.eventText: Because Sorin's AT-ST was not defeated, the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
